content:
IReliableDictionary<TKey, TValue> IReliableDictionary(Of TKey, TValue) Interface

Definition

Namespace:
Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.Collections
Assembly:
Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.Interfaces.dll

Represents a reliable collection of key/value pairs that are persisted and replicated.

Edit

In this Article

public interface IReliableDictionary<TKey, TValue> : IReliableCollection<KeyValuePair<TKey, TValue>>, IReliableState where TKey : IComparable<TKey>, IEquatable<TKey>Public Interface IReliableDictionary(Of TKey As {IComparable(Of TKey), IEquatable(Of TKey)}, TValue)
    Inherits IReliableCollection(Of KeyValuePair(Of TKey, TValue))

Type Parameters

TKey

The type of the keys in the reliable dictionary.
TValue

The type of the values in the reliable dictionary.

Inherited Members

Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.Collections.IReliableCollection{System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{{TKey},{TValue}}}

GetCountAsync(ITransaction)GetCountAsync(ITransaction)
ClearAsync()ClearAsync()

Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.IReliableState

NameName

Remarks

Keys or values stored in this dictionary MUST NOT be mutated outside the context of an operation on the dictionary. It is highly recommended to make both TKey and TValue immutable in order to avoid accidental data corruption.

Transaction is the unit of concurrency: Users can have multiple transactions in-flight at any given point of time but for a given transaction each API must be called one at a time. So all Reliable Collection APIs that take in a transaction and return a Task, must be awaited one at a time. ITransaction

Properties

RebuildNotificationAsyncCallback RebuildNotificationAsyncCallback

Edit

Occurs when dictionary is being rebuild during copy, restore and recovery.

Func<IReliableDictionary<TKey, TValue>, NotifyDictionaryRebuildEventArgs<TKey, TValue>, Task> RebuildNotificationAsyncCallback { set; }WriteOnly Property RebuildNotificationAsyncCallback As Func(Of IReliableDictionary(Of TKey, TValue), NotifyDictionaryRebuildEventArgs(Of TKey, TValue), Task)
Value
Func<IReliableDictionary<TKey, TValue>, NotifyDictionaryRebuildEventArgs<TKey, TValue>, Task> Func(Of IReliableDictionary(Of TKey, TValue), NotifyDictionaryRebuildEventArgs(Of TKey, TValue), Task)

The asynchronous rebuild notification function. Function takes in IReliableDictionary and NotifyDictionaryRebuildEventArgs token and returns a Task that represents the asynchronous processing of the rebuild notification.

Remarks

can only be used within this callback. Once the asynchronous callback completes, the becomes invalid.

FabricNotPrimaryException FabricNotPrimaryException

The exception that is thrown when the is not in .

InvalidOperationException InvalidOperationException

The exception that is thrown when a method call is invalid for the object's current state. Example, transaction used is already terminated: committed or aborted.

AddOrUpdateAsync(ITransaction, TKey, TValue, Func<TKey, TValue, TValue>) AddOrUpdateAsync(ITransaction, TKey, TValue, Func(Of TKey, TValue, TValue))

Edit

Adds a key/value pair to the reliable dictionary if the key does not already exist, or updates a key/value pair in the reliable dictionary by using the specified function if the key already exists.

Task<TValue> AddOrUpdateAsync(ITransaction tx, TKey key, TValue addValue, Func<TKey, TValue, TValue> updateValueFactory)Function AddOrUpdateAsync(tx As ITransaction, key As TKey, addValue As TValue, updateValueFactory As Func(Of TKey, TValue, TValue)) As Task(Of TValue)
Parameters
tx
ITransaction ITransaction

Transaction to associate this operation with.

key
TKey TKey

The key to be added or whose value should be updated.

addValue
TValue TValue

The value to be added for an absent key. The value can be null for reference types.

updateValueFactory
Func<TKey, TValue, TValue> Func(Of TKey, TValue, TValue)

The function used to generate a new value for an existing key based on the key's existing value.

Returns
Task<TValue> Task(Of TValue)

Task that represents the asynchronous add or update operation. The task result is the new value for the key. This will be either addValue (if the key was absent) or the result of updateValueFactory (if the key was present).

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException ArgumentNullException

tx is null, or key is null or cannot be serialized, or updateValueFactory is null.

TimeoutException TimeoutException

The operation failed to complete within the default timeout.

FabricNotPrimaryException FabricNotPrimaryException

The exception that is thrown when the is not in .

InvalidOperationException InvalidOperationException

The exception that is thrown when a method call is invalid for the object's current state. Example, transaction used is already terminated: committed or aborted.

Exception indicates that the Reliable Dictionary cannot serve reads at the moment. can be thrown in all s. One example for it being thrown in the is loss of . One example for it being thrown in the is that Reliable Collection's state is not yet consistent.

CreateEnumerableAsync(ITransaction) CreateEnumerableAsync(ITransaction)

Edit

Creates an async enumerator over the IReliableDictionary<TKey, TValue>.

Task<IAsyncEnumerable<KeyValuePair<TKey, TValue>>> CreateEnumerableAsync(ITransaction txn)Function CreateEnumerableAsync(txn As ITransaction) As Task(Of IAsyncEnumerable(Of KeyValuePair(Of TKey, TValue)))
Parameters
txn
ITransaction ITransaction

Transaction to associate this operation with.

Returns
Task<IAsyncEnumerable<KeyValuePair<TKey, TValue>>> Task(Of IAsyncEnumerable(Of KeyValuePair(Of TKey, TValue)))

An enumerator for the reliable dictionary.

Exceptions
FabricNotReadableException FabricNotReadableException

Exception indicates that the Reliable Dictionary cannot serve reads at the moment. can be thrown in all s. One example for it being thrown in the is loss of . One example for it being thrown in the is that Reliable Collection's state is not yet consistent.

InvalidOperationException InvalidOperationException

The exception that is thrown when a method call is invalid for the object's current state. Example, transaction used is already terminated: committed or aborted.

Remarks

The enumerator returned from the reliable dictionary is safe to use concurrently with reads and writes to the dictionary. It represents a snapshot consistent view of the dictionary.

Func<TKey, TValue> Func(Of TKey, TValue)

The function used to generate a value for the key.

timeout
TimeSpan TimeSpan

The amount of time to wait for the operation to complete before throwing a TimeoutException. Primarily used to prevent deadlocks. The default is 4 seconds.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is None.

Returns
Task<TValue> Task(Of TValue)

A task that represents the asynchronous add operation. The task result is the value for the key. This will be either the existing value for the key if the key is already in the dictionary, or the new value for the key as returned by valueFactory if the key was not in the dictionary.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException ArgumentNullException

tx is null, or key is null or cannot be serialized, or valueFactory is null.

ArgumentException ArgumentException

timeout is negative.

TimeoutException TimeoutException

The operation failed to complete within the given timeout.

OperationCanceledException OperationCanceledException

The operation was canceled.

FabricNotPrimaryException FabricNotPrimaryException

The exception that is thrown when the is not in .

InvalidOperationException InvalidOperationException

The exception that is thrown when a method call is invalid for the object's current state. Example, transaction used is already terminated: committed or aborted.

FabricNotReadableException FabricNotReadableException

Exception indicates that the Reliable Dictionary cannot serve reads at the moment. can be thrown in all s. One example for it being thrown in the is loss of . One example for it being thrown in the is that Reliable Dictionary's state is not yet consistent.

InvalidOperationException InvalidOperationException

The exception that is thrown when a method call is invalid for the object's current state. Example, transaction used is already terminated: committed or aborted.
